title: Baluster
summary: A baluster is a vertical moulded shaft, square, or lathe-turned form found in stairways, parapets, and other architectural features.  In furniture construction it is known as a spindle. Common materials used in its construction are wood, stone, and less frequently metal and ceramic. A group of balusters supporting a handrail, coping, or ornamental detail are known as a  balustrade.[1][2]
